intro: Parsonsia ovata, commonly known as the golden torch or flame vine, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, orange-red tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has thin, woody stems and heart-shaped leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in coastal and sandy regions. Parsonsia ovata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated as a garden plant.
